snippet: A conviction of securities fraud, wire fraud and mail fraud could be overturned because it might not apply to foreign transactions.
abstract: Floyd Norris High & Low Finance column on Ross H Mandell, who was convicted in New York of securities, wire and mail fraud and sentenced to 12 years in prison; says it seems likely that Mandell's convictions will be overturned because most of his victims were British, with the securities traded in London, not New York, meaning charges may not apply to the foreign transactions.
lead_paragraph: A conviction of securities fraud, wire fraud and mail fraud could be overturned because it might not apply to foreign transactions.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Justice In Collision With Foreign Fraud
headline.main: U.S. Justice in Collision With Foreign Fraud
